frameDefinitions: A Behavior is classified as entrenched for a Protagonist or a Society.
An Agent resolves an outstanding Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
A Cognizer has a relatively fixed positive or negative point of view towards an Issue.
An Agent is responsible for having intentionally performed an Act or for being the or a primary instigator behind the Act.
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
frameExamples: As it turns out, putting all of my eggs in one basket completely <t>solved</t> all of my problems.
It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
In interviews , it seems like everyone is completely <t>against</t> this expenditure .
It has been determined that a relatively unknown terrorist group is <t>responsible</t> for the recent attacks.
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
listRoleDefinitions: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen>.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate whose entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen> is at issue.
This role marks expressions that indicate a region where the <fen>Behavior</fen> is  entrenched.
The <fen>Agent</fen> finds the solution or explanation to the outstanding mystery or <fen>Problem</fen>.
The <fen>Problem</fen> is the predicament or mystery that is resolved.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-Agentive event or state of affairs that brings about the resolution of the <fen>Problem</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Problem</fen> is resolved.
This role indicates the location at which the <fen>Problem</fen> is resolved.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
The individual that holds an opinion on an <fen>Issue</fen> or Side.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a positive or negative opinion about.
The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has an opinion about.
An action taken by a <fen>Side</fen> or a view that the <fen>Side</fen> takes on an issue which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> either supports or opposes.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the indicated point of view towards the <fen>Issue</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
The state-of-affairs which prevents <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
listRoleExamples: <fex>His</fex> custom was to come here for the 10 o'clock service.

We can help , you to meet Egyptian people and learn about 
<fex>Egyptian</fex> customs.
They found that a loca custom <fex>in the country</fex> was to walk around barefoot at all times of the year and in all weathers .
If <fex>we</fex> have not been able to resolve a problem to your satisfaction, please email us.
Likewise, once the students worked through <fex>the problem</fex> and obtained their results, their next assignment would be to publish these to the web.
First, <fex>the Tripartite Agreement of 1979</fex> actually solved the only significant friction between the two countries.
A group of international scientists solved the fundamental particle hierarchy question <fex>at an underground accelerator</fex>.
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.
<fex>Last year</fex> she opposed the bill, but changed her mind after she received correspondence supporting the bill.
He was told that <fex>when he got back</fex> , his column needed a serious rethink .
<fex>In California</fex> , seatbelts must be fastened at all times .
